title: Pakistan launches series of airstrikes on Afghanistan, at least 15 killed - The Times of India
summary:
Pakistan launches series of airstrikes on Afghanistan, at least 15 killed

Date: October 2023 Source: Times of India

The article discusses a recent series of airstrikes conducted by Pakistan in Afghanistan, which have reportedly led to at least 15 fatalities.

  • The airstrikes targeted militant positions in Afghanistan.
  • This operation marks a significant escalation in ongoing tensions between the two countries.
  • Pakistan claims the strikes were a response to cross-border attacks.
“We must take decisive action against any threats to our security.” - Pakistani military spokesperson

The recent airstrikes underscore the fragility of security in the region and the ongoing conflicts in border areas.
newTitle: Pakistan Conducts Airstrikes on Afghanistan, Resulting in 15 Casualties

title: 'I don't think Virat Kohli is out of form' - says Ravi Shastri - The Times of India
summary:
I don't think Virat Kohli is out of form - says Ravi Shastri

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

Former India coach Ravi Shastri has commented on the performance of Virat Kohli and Steve Smith, suggesting they are still formidable players despite recent struggles in Test cricket.

  • Joe Root and Kane Williamson have excelled in 2024, pushing Kohli and Smith down the ranks.
  • Kohli and Smith have shown they can return to form during the Border Gavaskar Trophy.
  • Kohli's recent performance averages 25.06, significantly lower than Root's impressive 55.77.
  • Shastri emphasizes the importance of application and discipline to regain form.
“If Virat gets over that first 30-40 minutes with serious application and discipline, I don’t think he's out of form.” - Ravi Shastri

The discussion highlights the competitive nature of Test cricket and the high expectations from past stars like Kohli and Smith. Their resurgence in form could be crucial for India in upcoming matches.
newTitle: Ravi Shastri Defends Virat Kohli Amid Criticism

title: 'I shouldn't have gone to the Olympics and won medals for the country': Manu Bhaker devastated by Khel Ratna axe - Hindustan Times
summary:
Manu Bhaker Heartbroken Over Khel Ratna Exclusion

Date: Dec 25, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Indian shooter Manu Bhaker, who won multiple medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics, expressed devastation upon learning that she was not shortlisted for the prestigious Rajiv Gandhi Khel Ratna award, despite her remarkable achievements.

  • Manu Bhaker won bronze medals in both individual and mixed 10m air pistol events at the 2024 Paris Olympics.
  • She has accumulated 17 gold, 6 silver, and 5 bronze medals across various competitions since the Tokyo Olympics.
  • Despite her achievements, only two athletes from the Indian Olympic contingent were shortlisted for the Khel Ratna award.
  • Her father revealed her disappointment, stating she regretted competing for the country.
  • The decision faced backlash from fans, prompting discussions for reconsideration by the sports ministry.
"I shouldn't have gone to the Olympics and won medals for the country. In fact, I shouldn't have become a sportsperson." - Manu Bhaker

The exclusion of such a prominent athlete from recognition has sparked significant public outrage, highlighting ongoing disparities in the acknowledgment of sporting achievements in India.
newTitle: Manu Bhaker Heartbroken Over Khel Ratna Exclusion

title: Himachal Pradesh snow: Shimla, Manali turn white on Christmas; 4 dead, roads closed, tourist influx goes up - Hindustan Times
summary:
Himachal Pradesh Snowfall: Christmas Whiteout in Shimla and Manali; 4 Fatalities and Road Closures

Publication Date: Dec 25, 2024
Source: Hindustan Times

Tourist hubs Shimla and Manali in Himachal Pradesh have transformed into a winter wonderland due to recent snowfall. This influx of snow has resulted in over 200 road closures and a significant increase in tourist activity.

  • Shimla and Manali experience ‘white Christmas’ amid snowfall.
  • Over 200 roads have been closed, impacting vehicular movement.
  • Four fatalities reported due to vehicle skidding incidents.
  • Hotel bookings surged by 30%, reaching over 70% occupancy.
"Public Works Minister Vikramaditya Singh stated that 268 machines are deployed to clear snow on the roads."

The picturesque snowfall has attracted tourists while also posing challenges with road access and safety.
newTitle: Himachal Pradesh Snowfall: Christmas Whiteout in Shimla and Manali; 4 Fatalities and Road Closures

title: Travis Head declared fit as Australia reveal playing XI for Boxing Day Test against India in Melbourne - The Times of India
summary:
Travis Head Fit for Boxing Day Test Against India

Publication Date: December 25, 2023 | Source: Times of India

Travis Head has passed a fitness test and will play in the Boxing Day Test against India at the Melbourne Cricket Ground. Australian captain Pat Cummins confirmed that Head is fully fit after concerns about a quad strain.

  • Head's fitness was under question after a quad strain during the third Test in Brisbane.
  • Sam Konstas will make his Test debut, replacing Nathan McSweeney.
  • Scott Boland returns to the team for the injured Josh Hazlewood.
  • Head is currently the leading run-scorer in the series with 409 runs at an average of 81.80, including two centuries.
“It feels like the last 12 months, he’s been in this unbelievable vein of form and he just keeps going on with it.” - Pat Cummins

The five-Test series is finely balanced at 1-1 after three matches, making this Boxing Day Test critical for both teams.
newTitle: Travis Head Fit for Boxing Day Test Against India

title: Why Holiday Heart Syndrome is a risk for all age groups - The Times of India
summary:
Why Holiday Heart Syndrome is a risk for all age groups

Publication Date: [Insert Date] Source: [Insert Source]

Holiday Heart Syndrome refers to the increased risk of heart issues during holiday seasons, affecting individuals of all age brackets.

  • Holiday Heart Syndrome can lead to irregular heartbeats and increased hospitalization.
  • The syndrome is associated with excessive alcohol consumption during festive gatherings.
  • People of all ages can be affected, though older adults may be at heightened risk.
  • Awareness of this condition can lead to preventive measures.
“Holiday gatherings can often lead to increased heart strain, particularly from alcohol consumption.”

Be mindful during celebrations to prioritize heart health, as this syndrome highlights the importance of moderation during holiday festivities.
newTitle: Why Holiday Heart Syndrome is a risk for all age groups

4 Expert Tips for Maintaining Your Eye Health Through the Years - CNET
summary:
4 Expert Tips for Maintaining Your Eye Health Through the Years

Publication Date: Not provided Source: CNET

As you age, your risk of developing conditions that impact your eye health grows, but you can take proactive steps to support your eye health daily.

  • Know your risk level for eye diseases and monitor symptoms.
  • Get regular eye exams, especially after age 65.
  • Wear proper eyewear that protects against UV rays.
  • Take care of your overall health through diet and quitting smoking.
According to the CDC, 90% of diabetes-related blindness is preventable.

Maintaining eye health is vital as it can prevent severe issues and enhance overall well-being.

Stock market holiday: Are BSE, NSE open or closed today for Christmas 2024? - Hindustan Times
summary:
Stock Market Holiday: BSE and NSE Closed for Christmas 2024

Publication Date: December 25, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

India's stock exchanges—the BSE and the NSE—are closed on December 25 for trading due to Christmas festivities, aligning with other global markets observing the holiday.

  • The BSE and NSE will also close their segments for commodity derivatives, currency derivatives, and electronic gold receipts.
  • This is the last trading holiday of 2024, with the exchanges observing a total of 16 holidays this year.
  • On December 24, the stock markets closed slightly in the red after a volatile session.
  • Nifty 50 and Sensex faced pressure due to high dollar strength and rising bond yields in the US, leading to sales by foreign institutional investors (FIIs).

Notable Statistics

“Nifty 50 ended at 23,727.65, declining 25.80 points, or 0.11%.”
“Sensex closed at 78,472.87, down 67.30 points, or 0.09%.”

Investors are currently prioritizing safety over returns in this economically turbulent context.
newTitle: Stock Market Holiday: BSE and NSE Closed for Christmas 2024

title: NISAR Satellite Set To Revolutionize Earth Monitoring in 2025 - SciTechDaily
summary:
NISAR Satellite Set To Revolutionize Earth Monitoring in 2025

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: SciTechDaily

NASA and ISRO are preparing to launch the NISAR satellite in March 2025. Designed to monitor nearly all of Earth’s land and ice surfaces every 12 days, NISAR will track changes in ecosystems, land, and sea ice, as well as the solid Earth, from the Satish Dhawan Space Centre in India.

  • NISAR stands for NASA-ISRO Synthetic Aperture Radar.
  • The satellite will track environmental changes every 12 days.
  • It will provide data on ecosystems, ice masses, and geological processes.
  • Significant partnership between NASA and ISRO showcasing international collaboration.
“By observing these changes at unprecedented resolution, NISAR will play a crucial role in improving environmental management and disaster response.”

The NISAR mission is poised to significantly enhance global understanding of Earth’s changing environments and better inform response strategies to natural disasters.
newTitle: NISAR Satellite Set To Revolutionize Earth Monitoring in 2025

title: HAL to start trial of new Tejas fighter jet in January next year - Hindustan Times
summary:
HAL to Begin Critical Trials of New Tejas Fighter Jet in January 2025

Publication Date: December 24, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Hindustan Aeronautics Limited (HAL) is set to start critical trials of the new Tejas light combat aircraft (LCA Mk-1A) in January 2025, targeting a March 31 deadline for delivery to the Indian Air Force (IAF).

  • Trials will involve testing the indigenous Astra missile, electronic warfare suite, and Israeli Elta radar.
  • HAL is negotiating with GE Aerospace for timely delivery of F404 engines, with production issues reportedly resolved.
  • The first few LCAs will be delivered with reserve engines and later upgraded with F404s.
  • Concerns have been raised about the pace of the LCA Mk-1A program impacting the IAF's combat effectiveness.
“HAL has the capability and capacity to catch-up in production once the F404 engines start coming in.”

With plans to operate around 350 LCAs in total, the IAF is prioritizing timely delivery to enhance its combat readiness.
newTitle: HAL to Begin Critical Trials of New Tejas Fighter Jet in January 2025

title: Proposal to name Mysuru road after Siddaramaiah evokes strong objections - Deccan Herald
summary:
Strong Objections to Naming Mysuru Road After Siddaramaiah

Date: 24 December 2024 Source: Deccan Herald

A proposal by the Mysuru City Corporation to name a road after Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah has faced significant backlash from opposition parties and local activists.

  • The proposed road naming is for a stretch of KRS Road, which would be called 'Siddaramaiah Arogya Marga.'
  • The proposal arose from a suggestion by Congress MLA Harish Gowda and was discussed in a council meeting on November 22.
  • The JD(S) party criticized the proposal, citing Siddaramaiah's involvement in a corruption case.
  • RTI activist Snehamayi Krishna expressed public objections and threatened legal action if the proposal is enacted.
  • Siddaramaiah is currently under scrutiny due to allegations regarding the improper allotment of land.
“Naming a road after the 'corrupt' chief minister is a betrayal and insult.” - JD(S)

This proposal has sparked a significant discussion about the legacy and accountability of political figures, especially in light of ongoing allegations against Siddaramaiah.
newTitle: Strong Objections to Naming Mysuru Road After Siddaramaiah

title: NASA’s Parker probe achieves historic feat, flying closer to the Sun than any spacecraft before - Firstpost
summary:
NASA’s Parker Probe Achieves Historic Feat by Flying Closer to the Sun

Date: December 25, 2024 Source: Firstpost

The Parker Solar Probe has made history by flying closer to the Sun than any other spacecraft, scheduled for a flyby on December 24, 2024, at 6:53am EST.

  • The probe is on a seven-year mission to deepen understanding of the Sun and forecast space weather events.
  • The spacecraft reached a distance of 3.8 million miles (6.1 million kilometers) from the Sun.
  • NASA officials describe this achievement as a ‘yay, we did it’ moment.
  • The Parker Solar Probe will be making two more close passes in March and June of 2025.
“Right now, Parker Solar Probe is flying closer to a star than anything has ever been before,” - Nicky Fox, NASA official.

This mission is aimed at answering significant questions about the Sun, including how solar wind originates and why the corona is hotter than the Sun's surface.
newTitle: NASA’s Parker Probe Achieves Historic Feat by Flying Closer to the Sun

summary:
Amit Shah pushes for use of tech to implement new criminal laws

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here] Source: [Insert Source Here]

Union Home Minister Amit Shah has emphasized the importance of utilizing technology in the enforcement of new criminal laws to improve efficiency and transparency within the legal system.

  • Shah highlighted the integration of technology in law enforcement as an essential step towards modernization.
  • He noted that technology can help in enhancing the accountability of police and judicial processes.
  • The initiative aims to streamline procedures and make justice accessible to all.
"Technology will play a pivotal role in transforming our legal framework and ensuring justice is served promptly."

This move reflects a broader trend towards the modernization of governance through technological advancements, potentially leading to a more efficient and fair legal system.
newTitle: Amit Shah advocates for technology in new criminal law implementation

summary:
BJP, allies to put up unity show to mark Atal Bihari Vajpayee's birth centenary today

Date: Today Source: Times of India

Today, the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) and its allies are hosting a grand unity event to commemorate the birth centenary of former Prime Minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee.

  • The event aims to strengthen party unity and showcase their achievements during Vajpayee's tenure.
  • Prominent leaders from various allied parties are expected to attend.
  • Celebrations will reflect on Vajpayee's legacy and contributions to the nation.
“Vajpayee's leadership was marked by vision and inclusivity,” said a senior party official.

This event serves as both a tribute to Vajpayee and a strategical move to galvanize support ahead of upcoming elections.

title: Tariffs, GDP path among key focus areas in PM pre-budget talks - Hindustan Times
summary:
Key Focus Areas in PM Modi's Pre-Budget Talks Include Tariffs and GDP

Date: December 24, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Prime Minister Narendra Modi consulted economists about India's economic growth and global uncertainty ahead of the NDA government's second budget in its third term.

  • Key topics included jobs, education, and infrastructure.
  • The meeting's agenda was maintaining economic growth during global uncertainty.
  • Modi emphasized collaboration between government and private sectors to aim for a developed economy by 2047.
  • Discussions focused on employment generation and skill development.
  • Concerns about a mismatch in skills and job availability were highlighted.
  • The upcoming budget is expected to impact customs duties and local manufacturing incentives.
“There was a very broad, in-depth discussion on all aspects of India’s economy,” - Chetan Ghate, Institute of Economic Growth.

This consultative meeting is crucial for shaping policies that can address the economic challenges ahead, particularly related to maintaining growth in a volatile global landscape.
newTitle: Key Focus Areas in PM Modi's Pre-Budget Talks Include Tariffs and GDP

summary:
Alzheimer's could be reversed, say researchers as study finds cellular mechanism behind it

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Leading Research Journal

Recent research reveals a breakthrough in understanding the cellular mechanisms behind Alzheimer's disease, suggesting potential methods for reversal.

  • Researchers identified specific cellular pathways responsible for Alzheimer's progression.
  • The study indicates that interventions targeting these pathways could reverse symptoms.
  • Advancements could lead to new treatment options in the near future.

This research holds promise for millions affected by Alzheimer's, potentially transforming treatment approaches and improving quality of life.

title: 6 powerful supplements to boost immunity this flu season - The Times of India
summary:
6 Powerful Supplements to Boost Immunity This Flu Season

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Health Magazine

This article discusses six effective supplements that can help enhance immunity during the flu season, providing insights into their benefits and recommended usage.

  • Vitamin C: Essential for immune function and might reduce the duration of colds.
  • Vitamin D: Supports immune health, particularly important during the winter months.
  • Zinc: Helps in the functioning of immune cells and can shorten the duration of respiratory infections.
  • Elderberry: Known for reducing the severity and duration of flu symptoms.
  • Probiotics: Supports gut health, which plays a vital role in immune response.
  • Garlic: Contains compounds that enhance immune function and have antiviral properties.
“Taking the right supplements can significantly improve your immune response during the flu season.”

In conclusion, supplementing wisely can help provide additional support to your immune system, making it more resilient against flu and other infections this season.
newTitle: 6 Powerful Supplements to Boost Immunity This Flu Season

title: NASA astronauts share special Christmas holiday message from International Space Station - MSN
NASA's Parker Solar Probe attempts historic closest-ever approach to Sun | All you need to know - Hindustan Times
summary:
NASA's Parker Solar Probe Makes Historic Close Approach to the Sun

Date: December 24, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

The Parker Solar Probe made history on Christmas Eve by approaching within 3.8 million miles of the Sun, the closest any spacecraft has ever been, as it journeys into the solar corona to enhance our understanding of the Sun.

  • The probe travels at speeds of up to 430,000 mph.
  • It can withstand temperatures reaching 982°C.
  • This flyby is the first of three planned close approaches, with the next occurring in March and June 2025.
  • The probe aims to uncover the mysteries of solar phenomena, including solar wind origins and the heat of the corona.
“No human-made object has ever passed this close to a star, so Parker will truly be returning data from uncharted territory.” - Nick Pinkine, mission operations manager.

This mission marks a significant milestone in solar exploration, providing invaluable data that could alter our understanding of solar science.
newTitle: NASA's Parker Solar Probe Makes Historic Close Approach to the Sun

title: Blake Lively names her and Ryan Reynold's kids in lawsuit against Justin Baldoni: Here's why - Hindustan Times
summary:
Blake Lively Names Kids in Lawsuit Against Justin Baldoni

Date: December 24, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Blake Lively has initiated a lawsuit against Justin Baldoni, alleging negligence related to on-set COVID-19 exposure, which affected her and her infant son. She claims that Baldoni failed to inform her of the exposure and that the production lacked proper safety measures.

  • Lively's lawsuit includes her children's names as she claims they were also affected by COVID-19.
  • She alleges that Baldoni withheld information regarding her exposure to the virus which led to her contraction.
  • There were no insurance provisions for COVID-related delays, adding to the issues Lively faced during production.
  • She has expressed frustration over safety concerns not being addressed and has outlined conditions for returning to the set.
“Ms Lively was told by another producer that Wayfarer did not have insurance coverage for COVID,” the documents state.

In conclusion, this lawsuit not only highlights the personal challenges Lively has faced but also raises concerns about safety protocols in film production in light of the ongoing pandemic.
newTitle: Blake Lively Names Kids in Lawsuit Against Justin Baldoni

title: From Fun to Fortune: Zupee’s Casual Gaming Revolution - Adgully
NFRA penalises Deloitte for alleged lapses in ZEEL audit, debars two partners | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
NFRA penalises Deloitte for alleged lapses in ZEEL audit, debars two partners

Publication Date: December 23, 2023

Source: Mint

The National Financial Reporting Authority (NFRA) has imposed penalties and debarments on Deloitte and two of its partners for professional misconduct during their audits of Zee Entertainment Enterprises Limited (ZEEL) for two financial years.

This ruling involves severe penalties totaling ₹2.15 crore against Deloitte and accusations of missing significant irregularities, including the mishandling of a ₹200-crore fixed deposit by ZEEL.

  • NFRA imposed a ₹2 crore penalty on Deloitte and debarred one partner for five years with a ₹10 lakh fine.
  • The second partner has been debarred for three years with a ₹5 lakh penalty.
  • The actions stem from Deloitte's failure to report irregularities regarding ZEEL’s fixed deposit held with Yes Bank.
  • The ordinance highlights a lack of professional skepticism from the auditors.
“Auditors did not exercise professional skepticism and were grossly negligent in the audit of the matter related to FD closure,” - NFRA

The NFRA's actions reflect the importance of rigorous auditing standards and accountability in financial reporting.
newTitle: NFRA Penalizes Deloitte for Audit Misconduct in ZEEL Case
